questions.question: What is the prevailing theory explaining the origin and evolution of the universe?
questions.answer: Big Bang Theory

questions.question: Approximately how old is the universe according to current estimates?
questions.answer: 13.8 billion years

questions.question: Who first proposed the concept of an expanding universe in the 1920s?
questions.answer: Georges Lemaître

questions.question: What observation provided crucial evidence for the expanding universe?
questions.answer: Galactic redshifts

questions.question: What is Hubble's Law?
choices: The universe is expanding at a constant rate
Galaxies are moving away from us faster the farther away they are
The speed of light is constant in all reference frames
The total mass-energy of the universe is constant
questions.answer: Galaxies are moving away from us faster the farther away they are

questions.question: What is the cosmic microwave background (CMB) radiation?
choices: The oldest light in the universe
questions.answer: The oldest light in the universe

questions.question: When was the cosmic microwave background radiation discovered?
Who accidentally discovered the cosmic microwave background radiation?
questions.answer: Arno Penzias and Robert Wilson

questions.question: What does the cosmic microwave background radiation represent?
questions.answer: Radiation from the Big Bang

questions.question: What is the approximate temperature of the cosmic microwave background radiation?
questions.answer: 2.7 Kelvin

questions.question: What is Big Bang nucleosynthesis?
choices: The formation of heavy elements in stars
The creation of light elements in the early universe
questions.answer: The creation of light elements in the early universe

questions.question: Which light elements were primarily produced during Big Bang nucleosynthesis?
choices: Hydrogen, helium, and trace amounts of lithium
questions.answer: Hydrogen, helium, and trace amounts of lithium

questions.question: What does the large-scale structure of the universe resemble?
choices: A cosmic web of filaments, clusters, and voids
questions.answer: A cosmic web of filaments, clusters, and voids

questions.question: What is dark matter?
questions.answer: Matter that emits no light

questions.question: What evidence supports the existence of dark matter?
choices: Galactic rotation curves and gravitational lensing
questions.answer: Galactic rotation curves and gravitational lensing

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of the universe's matter is thought to be dark matter?
What is dark energy?
choices: A form of radiation not visible to telescopes
A mysterious force causing the accelerated expansion of the universe
The energy contained within dark matter
questions.answer: A mysterious force causing the accelerated expansion of the universe

questions.question: When was the accelerating expansion of the universe discovered?
questions.answer: Late 1990s

questions.question: What observation led to the discovery of the universe's accelerating expansion?
questions.answer: Distant supernovae

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of the universe's total energy content is estimated to be dark energy?
What is the 'Big Freeze' scenario?
choices: The universe will eventually stop expanding
All matter will freeze at absolute zero
The universe will expand forever, becoming cold and dark
Galaxies will freeze in their current positions
questions.answer: The universe will expand forever, becoming cold and dark

questions.question: What is the 'Big Crunch' scenario?
choices: The universe will collapse back on itself
All matter will be consumed by black holes
Galaxies will collide and merge into one super-galaxy
The expansion of the universe will suddenly stop
questions.answer: The universe will collapse back on itself

questions.question: What is cosmic inflation theory?
choices: A theory explaining the current acceleration of the universe
A model of how galaxies increase in size
A theory proposing a period of rapid expansion in the very early universe
An economic model applied to cosmic resources
questions.answer: A theory proposing a period of rapid expansion in the very early universe

questions.question: What does cosmic inflation theory attempt to explain?
choices: The uniformity of the CMB and the flatness of space
The abundance of heavy elements in the universe
questions.answer: The uniformity of the CMB and the flatness of space

questions.question: What is the significance of the cosmic microwave background's uniformity?
choices: It proves the universe is static
It suggests the universe was once much smaller and hotter
It indicates the presence of alien civilizations
It disproves the Big Bang theory
questions.answer: It suggests the universe was once much smaller and hotter

questions.question: What does the 'flatness' of space refer to in cosmology?
choices: The two-dimensional nature of the universe
The smooth texture of the cosmic microwave background
The balance between the universe's expansion rate and its matter/energy content
questions.answer: The balance between the universe's expansion rate and its matter/energy content

questions.question: What is the primary way astronomers detect dark matter?
choices: Through direct observation with optical telescopes
By measuring its gravitational effects on visible matter
Using special dark matter detectors on Earth
By analyzing the chemical composition of stars
questions.answer: By measuring its gravitational effects on visible matter

questions.question: What is the current understanding of the composition of the universe?
choices: Mostly ordinary matter with some dark matter
Equal parts ordinary matter, dark matter, and dark energy
Mostly dark energy, with significant dark matter and a small amount of ordinary matter
questions.answer: Mostly dark energy, with significant dark matter and a small amount of ordinary matter

questions.question: What is the significance of the Hubble constant?
choices: It determines the age of the Earth
It measures the rate of the universe's expansion
It calculates the mass of the Milky Way
It predicts the frequency of supernovae
questions.answer: It measures the rate of the universe's expansion

questions.question: What is the 'horizon problem' in cosmology?
choices: The difficulty in observing distant galaxies
The apparent uniformity of the CMB across regions that should not have been in causal contact
The limit of our ability to see beyond the cosmic horizon
The problem of determining the edge of the observable universe
questions.answer: The apparent uniformity of the CMB across regions that should not have been in causal contact
